sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The ghost of Richard the Third expressing himselfe in these three parts, [brace] 1. His character, 2. His legend, 3. His tragedie : containing more of him then hath been heretofore shewed, either in chronicles, playes, or poems. Brooke, Christopher, d. 1628.
[10], 6, [76] p.
Printed by G. Eld for L. Lisle and are to be sold in Paules Church-yard at the signe of the Tygers head, [London] : 1614.
In verse. Added illustrated t.p., with title: Richard the Third. Dedication signed: C.B. Signatures: [par.?]⁴ A-G⁴ H⁴(-H4?) I-L⁴ (last leaf blank). Commendatory verses by Geroge Chapman, William Browne, Francis Dynn, George Wither, Robert Daborne and Ben Jonson. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University. Library.
=======
The ghost of Richard the Third expressing himselfe in these three parts, [brace] 1. His character, 2. His legend, 3. His tragedie : containing more of him then hath been heretofore shewed, either in chronicles, playes, or poems. Brooke, Christopher, d. 1628.
[10], 6, [76] p.
Printed by G. Eld for L. Lisle and are to be sold in Paules Church-yard at the signe of the Tygers head, [London] : 1614.
In verse. Added illustrated t.p., with title: Richard the Third. Dedication signed: C.B. Signatures: [par.?]⁴ A-G⁴ H⁴(-H4?) I-L⁴ (last leaf blank). Commendatory verses by Geroge Chapman, William Browne, Francis Dynn, George Wither, Robert Daborne and Ben Jonson. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University. Library.
L. Lisle
G. Eld
Paules Church-yard at the signe of the Tygers head
